name: Keeping Up with the "Kardashians" Online Trivia | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: The Cardassian race were key players in "Deep Space 9", but which "Star Trek" series did they make their first appearance on?
questions.explanation:
The Next Generation.

	The first episode to feature a Cardassian was a season four episode of "TNG" called "The Wounded." Some of the Cardassian characters in this episode are shown with facial hair. In later appearances in both "TNG" and "DS9" no one in the race had facial hair.

questions.text: Chronologically the first appearance of a Cardassian was in "Enterprise" a series set decades before the original series. In what fashion did a member of the race appear?
options: As a background character in a bar scene
As a reference in a captain's log.
questions.explanation:
As a corpse.

	In the season two episode, the corpse of a Cardassian soldier is seen attached to the computer corp inside of an automated repair station the Enterprise is using to fix up the damaged ship. No reference to the race was mentioned, but fans of previous "Star Trek" series got the Easter egg included for their pleasure.

questions.text: During "The Occupation", as it was commonly referred to during the run of "Deep Space 9," the Cardassians strip-mined a planet, enslaved its population and committed genocide of more than 10 million inhabitants. What race did they commit such atrocities against?
options: Worm Hole Aliens (no definite race name known)
questions.explanation:
Bajorans.

	The Cardassian race occupied Bajor from stardate 2319 to 2369. During that 50 year timeline, the Cardassian captors did anything they wanted to the people and the planet, sending all of the resources back to Cardassia Prime. During the occupation, the Cardassians forced the Bajorans to build the space station Terok Nor, which was renamed Deep Space 9 when the Federation took control.

questions.text: While definitely an alien race, the Cardassians share many characteristics with humans; which is not one of them?
options: Two arms and two legs per individual
Placement of eyes, nose and mouth on the head
questions.explanation:
Forehead ridges and scaly necks.

	Due to the nature of prosthetics and make up restrictions, most of the alien races on the "Star Trek" television series share the same basic characteristics of humans, and then were make to look alien with slight variations. The Cardassians had large vertical ridges on each side of their head, scaly necks and a oval shaped ridge on the forehead that was almost in the shape of a spoon.

questions.text: Cardassian culture is a faith based society.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The Cardassians are a militaristic society with a hierarchy that puts the emphasis on family above all else. The Cardassians often started wars and conquered "lesser" races based on their desire to form large empires.

questions.text: With what alien culture did the Gul Dukat align the Cardassians?
questions.explanation:
The Dominion (Jem'Hadar).

	The Dominion was a unified consortium of hundreds of alien races primarily based in the Gamma Quadrant of space. As the group tried to advance and conquer portions of the Alpha Quadrant they were willing to align with some races in the quadrant in order to further their assault. Eventually during the run of "Deep Space 9" the Cardassians betrayed the Dominion and fought on the side of the Federation.

questions.text: The Cardassian Empire was (allegedly) lead by a group of elected officials known as what?
questions.explanation:
Detapa Council.

	The Detapa Council consisted of civilians and was in charge of major decision making for the empire on paper, but the true ruling power seemingly laid within the military ranks until after the Dominion War of stardate 2372. During the war, the council was overthrown and disbanded, only to be replaced by a series of failed attempts at governing the empire.

questions.text: The Cardassian tailor Garak appeared frequently on "Deep Space 9". It was often hinted at that before the occupation ended he had been a high ranking member of the military. What was he often accused of being?
options: A changeling disguised as a Cardassian
questions.explanation:
A spy.

	Members of the DS9 staff got to know the Garak well during the seven seasons that "Deep Space 9" was on television.  Over the course of the series, his history began to shine through, and we learned that he was in fact a former member of the Obsidian Order, which was a group similar to the Nazi regime's SS squad.

questions.text: With a lizard like appearance, it is no wonder that Cardassians prefer what type of climate?
questions.explanation:
Warm.

	Cardassians prefer a typically warmer climate than humans, and also have an aversion to bright lights, preferring a darker atmosphere. Cardassia Prime is the seventh planet from its solar system's sun, but due to the size of the star it still maintains a much warmer climate than Earth.

questions.text: Which is the only film among the original 10 "Star Trek" (before the rebooted franchise in 2009) to include a Cardassian in the cast?
questions.explanation:
First Contact.

	A few members of the Cardassian race were included as assimilated members of the Borg among the hordes on the cube ships that were attacking Earth. The scenes that included Cardassian and Romulan extras were cut from the theatrical release of the film, but reinstated for home video and television airings.
